intro: Doxomma cylindrostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stalked sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
